page.title: 17New Sluice Gates in Rye
page.content: On Thursday 2nd May 1985 we went across the road to ask the keeper of the new sluice gates a few questions. He told us that the gates cost 2.5 million pounds to build, but 3 million when the old locks are knocked down. The gates are automatic and the lock keeper only has to go and see them when they go wrong. They built the new ones because the old ones were too old and rotten. They are easier to work than the old ones and it took 15-17 months to build them. A sluice gate is needed to stop the place from flooding because we usually have a lot of high tides.
